docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Expectations
docs.text:
1. We treat each other with respect and we don’t make fun of each other or of our character choices.
  2. We make decisions by consensus.
  3. If we’re uncomfortable with something at the table, we address it openly and honestly at the table or in private with our game master. If someone else is uncomfortable, we listen to them, and act with compassion.
  4. We do our best to play monthly on a weekend, with Sundays strongly preferred.
  5. Our sessions start around 9 am or 10 am, last around 6 hours and go no longer than 7 hours.
  6. We play at a mutually agreed location. We do our best to accommodate our different transportation needs.
  7. We have food as a part of our games, either individually or as a group.
  8. We do our best to attend all our games, to show up on time every time, and to stay for the entire session.
  9. If we’re going to be late or can’t make it, we do our best to give at least a week’s notice, or as much as we can, knowing that sometimes, “life happens
  10. We want to have fun socialising, but we also want to prioritise making progress on the campaign.

docs.title: We’ll Encourage
docs.text:
• Fun and silliness when the stakes are low
  • Seriousness and gravitas when the situation demands
  • “True-to-life” roleplaying#

docs.title: We’re Fine With
docs.text:
• PC / PC Romance (consensual)
  • PC / NPC Romance (consensual)
  • Explorations of racism and colonialism as part of narrative arcs and character growth
  • Accents
  • Sad themes when appropriate, but not grinding awfulness.

docs.title: We’ll Obscure
docs.text: • Sexual acts

docs.title: We’ll Stay Away From
docs.text:
• Animal abuse or animal death
  • Child abuse or death
  • Sexual violence
  • Misogyny
  • Playing “evil” PCs
  • Extreme gore (i.e., torture porn)

docs.title: The GM is Not Out to Get You
docs.text:
Debates have raged since the dawn of D&D (if not before) over whether the GM’s goal is to “beat” or actively oppose Players, to act as a purely “neutral” arbiter of the rules, or to in some way “champion” the Players and their Characters.

Let it be known that your GM for this campaign takes the third position.

docs.title: Check Your Sources
docs.text:
The official rule set for this campaign shall be the D&D 5e 2024 core rules, as described in the 2024 editions of the Players Handbook, Dungeon Master’s Guide, and Monster Manual. Other 2014 edition core rule books (e.g., Tasha’s Cauldron of Everything, Volo’s Guide to Monsters) may be used at the GM’s discretion provided the content in question does not conflict with or confuse the “core” rules.

In addition, content from setting or adventure specific sources related to Critical Role’s “Exandria” setting may be allowed, at the GM’s discretion provided the content in question does not conflict with or confuse the “core” rules.

Unearthed Arcana (UA), other play-test materials, other open source materials, and homebrew materials are not allowed.

docs.title: The (Pinko) Rule of Cool
docs.text: The “Rule of Cool” shall hold sway at our table insofar as it advantages the party as a whole, or advantages a Character in such a way as to advantage the party. It shall not apply in cases where it would merely advantage a specific Player. Because inequity is not cool.

docs.title: Substituting Skills
docs.text: As the core rules make clear, the link between skills and abilities is not absolute. You may make a skill check using an alternate ability as the GM’s discretion.

docs.title: Bonus Action Quaffing
docs.text: Drinking a potion yourself is a bonus action. Feeding a potion to another person is an action.

docs.title: Perkins’ Critical
docs.text: When you roll a critical hit, instead of rolling damage twice or doubling your damage rolls, roll your damage dice once and use the attack’s maximum damage roll as the second result. Applies to PCs, NPCs, and foes.

docs.title: Kingsmill’s Brutal Criticals
docs.text:
f

  • Lookup Dael’s critical and wounding rules.

docs.title: Skill, Ability, and Save Critical Rolls
docs.text: Natural 1s and natural 20s respectively count as automatic failures or automatic successes on skill checks, ability checks, and saving throws. Applies to PCs, NPCs, and foes.

docs.title: Initiative Critical Successes
docs.text: Natural 20s on initiative checks allow a Player to decide where they will go in initiative after knowing how the other Players are ordered, but without knowing how NPCs or foes are ordered. Applies only to PCs.

docs.title: Mercer’s Resurrections
docs.text: Revivify works as in the rules as written. It is a defibrillator.

docs.title: “I Know a guy!”
docs.text: At the GM’s discretion, if the party cannot determine what to do to resolve a particular situation, a Player may declare that they “know a guy” and describe who their Character knows and how they hope the person can help. The GM reserves the right to modify the request or to accept it in spirit only.

docs.title: Downtime
docs.text: I like downtime. Let’s do more of that.

docs.title: Languages
docs.text: The campaign setting has numerous distinct cultures that have their own languages. For the purposes of roleplaying, it is assumed that these cultural and regional languages are dialects of “Common.” Some dialects may be more or less mutually intelligible with your own. Therefor, the GM may rule that one or more characters are unable to speak with a given NPC.

docs.title: Unencumbered by Encumbrance
docs.text: Encumbrance rules suck. When trying to move heavy loads over short or long distances, the GM may call for an appropriate check, impose disadvantage on specific checks, apply exhaustion, or rule the action impossible without additional help.
